definition: to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: They hawe find out who the man was.
sentences.chinese: 他们已查清了这个人是谁。

sentences.english: Woodland rodent species and distribution in highland Zhangjiakou district were investigated in the study.
sentences.chinese: 查清了张家口地区沿坝林区的啮齿动物种类和分布。

sentences.english: The association is responsible forascertaining that an application satisfies the relevant prerequisites.
sentences.chinese: 协会有责任查清申请是否满足有关条件。

sentences.english: I hope we can find out about it.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我们能查清此事。

sentences.english: The key question of investigating mine gas exploding accident is to find out the start site of gas exploding.
sentences.chinese: 确定瓦斯爆炸的爆源点是查清事故原因的关键。

sentences.english: It is not clear if the explosions were caused by bombs or hand grenades.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸事件是否因炸弹或手榴弹引起还尚待查清。

definition: to investigate and find out/to ascertain
to investigate thoroughly
to try to find out/to trace/to track down
to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
investigate/check out (a story)
to clarify/to fully understand
lit. to follow the vine to get to the melon/to track sth following clues
to investigate
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
culprit
to investigate/investigation/fact-checking
as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom)/the truth comes to light
to find out/to discover
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to verify/to check
to bring to justice
